I would like to try a mode/rule where creepers only explode if you hit them or another mob hits them. They would still creep on you and stand close but not explode until they take damage. I think that might suit them thematically a little better and reduce the number of craters you have to clear. You could also use them in combat to kill other mobs. I also kinda like creepers, I think they are cute, it would be nice if i could have a couple hang around as friends.

I couldn't possibly agree with this more. I don't mind when they explode on me but the way they grief the landscape ruins it for me. I also build in the nether quite a bit and would love for this feature to work with ghasts as well.

Searched specifically for "cat jump" in hopes that someone posted this. I for one believe that cats should be able to jump even HIGHER than that. 1.5 meter step height, 3 meter jump height! Cats in real life have no problem hopping casually up onto countertops, but will actually coil back and wind up to get REALLY high.

Why add Walruses?
The Frostburn Update (1.10) introduced Polar Bears to Minecraft. In my opinion Walruses would make a nice addition to the cold side of Minecraft. Polar Bears and the Walruses interact in a way (seen below) with each other which in my opinion is an other reason to implement them as well.

What is their behaviour?
Walruses live in herds with many other Walruses in the cold zones of Minecraft. Hence, Cold Ocean, Deep Cold Ocean, Frozen Ocean and Deep Frozen Ocean. Most of the time they can be found in water but occasionally they are lying on very small islands of ice they split with their own tusks from the landmass.
Walruses  are neutral towards players. However, if a player decides to punch their babies they become aggressive.
They eat all the types of fish which can be found in the abovementioned Biomes. Now and again Polar Bears try to attack Walrus babies if their parents aren't nearby.


What do they eat?
Walruses live off fish, mussels, snails and different crustaceants. Since fish are the only ones of these in Minecraft they eat them. 


What do Walruses drop after they are getting killed?
Most of the time they drop some fish but rarely also ivory. 


How do they look like in Minecraft?
A Walrus in Minecraft should have a slightly bigger size than a cow. They have long tusks.I have thought about this look (thanks to the Zoo and Wild Animals Mod):

Now thank you for reading. Looking forward to your feedback. :)

Or, alternatively, whenever you have two empty hands you can pick up any of your tamed cats. They don't appear as an item, but you can see that there is one being held when pressing E and looking at your character - similar to parrots. If you took damage, they would leave your hands, again, similar to parrots. If you switched your hand to be holding something, they would leap out and resume normal cat behaviour.

This would allow players to move a cat who is lying on a bed or sitting on a chest and have the added bonus of being super adorable!

I love the idea of adding sea bunnies to Minecraft! I don't think they should be tameable, though. In real life, they are toxic to touch, and Mojang probably doesn't want to be held responsible for children getting poisoned because they didn't know Minecraft sea bunnies were different from real ones! I think if they're added, they should be ambient mobs that spawn in coral reefs and poison players that touch their hitbox for a few seconds.

Ok, after my post not getting aprooval to get posted, I think this is the post that fits best my idea!

I think that Tortoises should exist in general. Not only Gopher Tortoises, but depending on the biome there should be different spieces of Tortoises. I think they should be not just another turtle. Thats' why, it would be nice to have a bit more "character".After some thinkkng, I realised that my idea was, the mechanics of villagers(their schedule), of dolphins(they will need both sunlight and shade to live) and,surprisigly, of bees!(being able to dig and get inside blocks!). Also being able to get inside their shell when threatened.I also think that they should actually place their eggs inside the earth(if that's possible). Maybe,the Tortoise scute could be used tocreate even a new type of block!I think tortoises should also actually sleep at night, and their baby form should e exetremely vulnerable to anything that walks over them, unless they are hiding in grass :-) Also, they should also be bred using flowers.

Now, this is a good idea, except soulsand contains souls. So maybe they could spawn on a new kind of soul fluid, like liquid soulsand. Then they would be able to crawl out of it. Otherwise, they would be trapped inside of soulsand for all eternity, until broken, then they could be released that way I guess. Ghosts wouldn't be able to be harmed, since they are already dead. They can't attack, so they would just set traps for the player that killed them. Entities cannot be haunted. They way the ghost would haunt the player is by making blocks fall on them, spawning anvils from the air, toggling doors, cutting redstone, and causing barriers to form in front of the player. The barriers would only last for one to three seconds. Depending on the ghost, other things could happen too. For witches, random dangerous potion effects would be applied to the player. For creepers, any TNT nearby would be detonated. For endermen, the player would be teleported one block in any direction, unless that space was taken. When skeletons are killed, no matter where they are, they would fall apart and come back together after a short time. Zombies would come back as zombified zombies, which are just zombies, but more decayed. This applies to all other zombie and skeleton variants. Sorry I said so much, hope this helps, and have a good day. (Edit) This would actually probably just be better as a mod.

Maybe they're like polietegrists. (Poli- noise, annoyance. Geist- ghost, ghoul.) They make noise, sound, and look like their normal selves, except they have more of an "OOOOOO" at the end, and are slightly transparent. They also watch you sleep and hover slightly off the ground, and make the same footstep sounds. (audio.)

Please proofread your posts, it's really hard to understand what you're saying when it's full of typoes =(

I don't think husks need to be especially hard.  They are an interesting zombie variant for the desert and are unique because they give hunger when they hit you.  Zombie type mobs tend to be more of a threat en masse than individually, and the husks are no different.

And no, I don't think the skeleton should be able to jump over holes.  A trench is a good subtle way of protecting your base against mobs for players who don't like big walls around everything.
Sory am not english , and i didnt mean that skelingtons can jump over a trench a vas thinking just a one block hole

And what I mean by a trench is a one block wide trench.  Something that's easy enough to jump over, but the mobs can't navigate it because they don't jump.

 

I think the beauty of the mobs is they're difficult to deal with when you don't know their mechanics, but they all have their weaknesses that can be exploited.  I don't think this game would be nearly as fun if they didn't have those weaknesses and were always a pain in the rear.
I think they just need to be more bulky. Jumping wouldnt make a whole lot of sense, so how about climbing?
